Generation I.Red: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.
Generation I.Yellow: In hot places, its internal gases could expand and explode without any warning. Be very careful!
Generation I.Stadium: A Pokémon that is a  like a thin-skinned balloon filled with a highly toxic gas. Known to occasionally explode.

Generation II.Gold: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.
Generation II.Silver: The poisonous gases it contains are a little bit lighter than air, keeping it slightly airborne.
Generation II.Crystal: If one gets close enough to it when it expels poisonous gas, the gas swirling inside it can be seen.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) The poisonous gases it contains are a little bit lighter than air, keeping it slightly airborne. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: If Koffing becomes agitated, it raises the toxicity of its internal gases and jets them out from all over its body. This Pok é mon may also overinflate its round body, then explode.
Generation III.Sapphire: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this Pok é mon .
Generation III.Emerald: Getting up close to a Koffing will give you a chance to observe, through its thin skin, the toxic gases swirling inside. It blows up at the slightest stimulation.
Generation III.FireRed: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning.

Generation IV.Diamond: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
Generation IV.Pearl: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
Generation IV.Platinum: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: The poisonous gases it contains are a little bit lighter than air, keeping it slightly airborne.

Generation V.Black: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
Generation V.White: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
Generation V.Black 2: Toxic gas is held within its thin, balloon-shaped body, so it can cause massive explosions.
Generation V.White 2: Toxic gas is held within its thin, balloon-shaped body, so it can cause massive explosions.

Generation VI.X: Its thin, balloon-like body is inflated by horribly toxic gases. It reeks when it is nearby.
Generation VI.Y: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell, they are also explosive.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: If Koffing becomes agitated, it raises the toxicity of its internal gases and jets them out from all over its body. This Pokémon may also overinflate its round body, then explode.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this Pokémon.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: In hot places, its internal gases could expand and explode without any warning. Be very careful!
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: In hot places, its internal gases could expand and explode without any warning. Be very careful!

Generation VIII.Sword: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.
Generation VIII.Shield: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell; they are also explosive.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Lighter-than-air gases in its body keep it aloft. The gases not only smell; they are also explosive.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Toxic gas is held within its thin, balloon-shaped body, so it can cause massive explosions.
Generation IX.Violet: The poisonous gases it contains are a little bit lighter than air. That's why it's always slightly airborne.
